dict.string: ⌘ ⌥: Add page number & then add another citation
Cite in Markdown and convert Markdown files to .docx, .pdf, .html, or .pptx with proper citations & bibliography
Pandoc-Suite for Citations and Bibliographies in Markdown

export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
citekey="{query}" bibfile=~`echo -n $bibtex_library_path | sed -e "s/~//"` csl=~`echo -n $csl_file | sed -e "s/~//"` dummyBib="---
nocite: |
 "$citekey"
---
::: {#refs}
:::"
echo -n $dummyBib | pandoc --citeproc --read=markdown --write=plain --csl $csl --bibliography $bibfile | tr "
" " "

-- this script puts the app into foreground that was in focus when the hotkey was triggered. -- this allows the following clipboard action later on to automatically paste the input into the app
on run
set focusedapp_id to (system attribute "focusedapp") tell application id focusedapp_id to activate --note: alfreds focused-app-variable passes not an app name, but the app-id, therefore they keyword "id" has to be added here. return "{query}" --passes through the query
end run

on alfred_script(q)
if application "Zotero" is running then return true else return false end if
end alfred_script

-- for whatever reason this Applescript does not work properly when combined with the previous one into one script.
on run display notification "Citation Picker will appear in a moment" with title "⏳ Starting Zotero..." tell application "Zotero" to activate set focusedapp_id to (system attribute "focusedapp") tell application id focusedapp_id to activate
delay 1
end run

on alfred_script(q) try tell application "CotEditor" set the_document to front document save the_document set hsf_path to file of the_document end tell end try if (hsf_path = missing value) then return "no_file_recognized" else return POSIX path of hsf_path end if end alfred_script

⚠️ No file was recognized.
This usually only happens when you have created a new document and have not saved it yet. Please save the document and try again.

on alfred_script(q) try tell application "iA Writer" set the_document to front document save the_document set hsf_path to file of the_document end tell end try if (hsf_path = missing value) then return "no_file_recognized" else return POSIX path of hsf_path end if end alfred_script

⚠️ Atom is open, but no file was recognized.
This usually only happens when you have created a new document and have not saved it yet. Please save the document and try again.

on alfred_script(q)
tell application "Atom" to activate tell application "System Events" to keystroke "s" using {command down} --workaround to save tell application "System Events" to tell process "Atom" set atomPath to name of window 1 end tell return atomPath
end alfred_script

⚠️ The selected file does not seem to be a Markdown file. Please select a markdown file and try again.
'{query}'

on alfred_script(q)
tell application "Finder" to set sel to selection if ((count sel) > 1) then set firstItem to item 1 of sel return POSIX path of (firstItem as text) else return POSIX path of (sel as text) end if
end alfred_script

⚠️ No PDF Engine set.
You have to set a PDF engine before using "pdf" as output format. You can do sp by triggering Alfred, typing "pconf", and selecting "PDF-Engine".

⚠️ You have not selected a BibTeX-Library.
You can do that by triggering Alfred, typing "pconf", and selecting "BibTeX Library".

# THESE VARIABLES MUST BE SET. SEE THE ONEUPDATER README FOR AN EXPLANATION OF EACH. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisgrieser/pandoc_alfred/main/info.plist' readonly workflow_url='chrisgrieser/pandoc_alfred' readonly download_type='github_release' readonly frequency_check='1'
# FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED! function abort { echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
function notification { local -r notificator="$(find . -type d -name 'Notificator.app')" if [[ -n "${notificator}" ]]; then "${notificator}/Contents/Resources/Scripts/notificator" --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" --subtitle 'A new version is available' return fi
local -r terminal_notifier="$(find . -type f -name 'terminal-notifier')" if [[ -n "${terminal_notifier}" ]]; then "${terminal_notifier}" -title "${alfred_workflow_name}" -subtitle 'A new version is available' -message "${1}" return fi
osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"${alfred_workflow_name}\" subtitle \"A new version is available\"" }
# Local sanity checks readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.' [[ "${download_type}" =~ ^(direct|page|github_release)$ ]] || abort "'download_type' (${download_type}) needs to be one of 'direct', 'page', or 'github_release'." [[ "${frequency_check}" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || abort "'frequency_check' (${frequency_check}) needs to be a number."
# Check for updates if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable."; fi # Remote sanity check
readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --silent --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")"
if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if [[ "${download_type}" == 'page' ]]; then notification 'Opening download page…' open "${workflow_url}" exit 0 fi
download_url="$([[ "${download_type}" == 'github_release' ]] && curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${workflow_url}/releases/latest" | grep 'browser_download_url' | head -1 | sed -E 's/.*browser_download_url": "(.*)"/\1/' || echo "${workflow_url}")"
if url_exists "${download_url}"; then notification 'Downloading and installing…' curl --silent --location --output "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" "${download_url}" open "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" else abort "'workflow_url' (${download_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi

--pandoc command construction
on run
--import environment variables (Shell Script part necessary to handle encoding, see https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/15992-applescript-reads-alfred-environment-variables-in-wrong-encoding/ set csl_file to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "csl_file") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set bibtex_library_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "bibtex_library_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set reference_docx_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "reference_docx_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set reference_pptx_path to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "reference_pptx_path") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set further_pandoc_args to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "further_pandoc_args") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" set second_library to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "second_library") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN" -- these omit the shell script detour as they will only have preset values without special characters set pdf_engine to (system attribute "pdf_engine") set desired_format to (system attribute "desired_format") set slide_level to (system attribute "slide_level")
--split doc_path into parent_folder and doc_name set doc_path to "{query}" set doc_name to doc_path repeat while (offset of "/" in doc_name) > 0 --loop checks whether a Slash is still in the string set doc_name to text ((offset of "/" in doc_name) + 1) thru -1 of doc_name end repeat
set parent_folder to text 1 thru -(1 + (length of doc_name)) of doc_path
--removes common Markdown file extensions from the doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".md" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdtxt" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".markdown" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".Rmd" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mkd" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdwn" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".mdown" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name set doc_name to text 1 thru ((offset of ".txt" in doc_name) - 1) of doc_name
-- building the elements of the pandoc command set bibliography to "" set bibliography2 to "" set reference_docx to "" set pdf_arg to "" set reference_pptx to ""
set input to (quoted form of doc_path) & " " set output to "-o " & (quoted form of (parent_folder & doc_name & "." & desired_format)) & " " set resource_path to "--resource-path=" & (quoted form of parent_folder) & " " if bibtex_library_path ≠ "" then set bibliography to "--bibliography " & (quoted form of bibtex_library_path) & " " if second_library ≠ "" then set bibliography2 to "--bibliography " & (quoted form of second_library) & " " set citation_style to "--csl " & (quoted form of csl_file) & " " set slide_level_arg to "--slide-level=" & slide_level & " " set further_args to further_pandoc_args & " " if reference_docx_path ≠ "" then set reference_docx to "--reference-doc " & (quoted form of reference_docx_path) & " " if reference_pptx_path ≠ "" then set reference_pptx to "--reference-doc " & (quoted form of reference_pptx_path) & " " if pdf_engine ≠ "" then set pdf_arg to "--pdf-engine=" & pdf_engine & " "
-- modifies command based on desired output format set pandoc_command to ("pandoc " & input & output & "--citeproc --metadata link-citations=true " & resource_path & bibliography & bibliography2 & citation_style & further_args) if desired_format = "docx" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & reference_docx) if desired_format = "pdf" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & pdf_arg) if desired_format = "html" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & "--standalone ") if desired_format = "pptx" then set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & reference_pptx & slide_level_arg) set pandoc_command to (pandoc_command & " 2>&1")
-- returns the pandoc-command to Alfred to process it as bash script return pandoc_command end run

set csl_file to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "csl_file") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN"
-- before, the workflow only searched the Zotero Style folder, making the saving of the full path unecessary if csl_file does not contain "/" then set csl_file_path to "~/Zotero/styles/" & csl_file tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to set configuration "csl_file" to value csl_file_path in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end if
set citation_picker to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "citation_picker") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN"
-- before, the workflow only searched the Zotero Style folder, making the saving of the full path unecessary if citation_picker is "" then set citation_picker to "alternative" tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to set configuration "citation_picker" to value citation_picker in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end if
--pass through query return "{query}"

[{"title":"🚪 Exit this Configuration","arg":"exit"},{"title":"🆕 ✴️ Citation Picker","arg":"citation_picker","subtitle":"currently: {var:citation_picker}"},{"title":"❓ Documentation & Guide for the Pandoc Suite","arg":"workflow_documentation","subtitle":"Troubleshooting & further Information"},{"title":"📚1️⃣ BibTeX Library","arg":"bibtex_lib","subtitle":"currently: {var:bibtex_library_path}"},{"title":"📚2️⃣ Additional Library (optional)","arg":"second_library","subtitle":"currently: {var:second_library}"},{"title":"✍️ Set Citation Style","arg":"set_csl","subtitle":"currently: {var:csl_file}"},{"title":"⬇️ Download New Citation Style","arg":"install_csl","subtitle":"From the CSL Style Repository"},{"title":"🔘 Hotkey Output Format","arg":"hotkey_format","subtitle":"currently: {var:hotkey_output_format}"},{"title":"📄 Word Reference Document","arg":"reference_docx","subtitle":"currently: {var:reference_docx_path}"},{"title":"🏎 PDF-Engine","arg":"pdf_engine","subtitle":"currently: {var:pdf_engine}"},{"title":"🧑‍🏫 Powerpoint Reference Presentation","arg":"reference_pptx","subtitle":"currently: {var:reference_pptx_path}"},{"title":"📊 Slide Level for Powerpoint","arg":"slide_level","subtitle":"currently: {var:slide_level}"},{"title":"❇️ Further Arguments","arg":"further_args","subtitle":"currently: {var:further_pandoc_args}"},{"title":"📧 Report an Issue to the Developer","arg":"email","subtitle":"will open your default mail client"}]
Sets the Output Format for the Hotkey

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "hotkey_output_format" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
return "{query}"
end run

-- sets file-name as csl_file in global variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "csl_file" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path set chosen_csl to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in chosen_csl) > 0 set chosen_csl to text ((offset of "/" in chosen_csl) +1) thru - 1 of chosen_csl end repeat
-- Returns without extension for the Alfred notification set chosen_csl_no_ext to text 1 thru -5 of chosen_csl return chosen_csl_no_ext
Alternatively, press [space] to list all installed Citation Styles.

Choose a Citation Style here. - Clicking a link will prompt Zotero to install the Style. - If you use a citation manager other than Zotero, move the downloaded .csl file to a location in your home folder.
Afterwards, you can set the citation style by using the 'pconf' command again.

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "reference_docx_path" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notification set docx_file_name to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in docx_file_name) > 0 set docx_file_name to text ((offset of "/" in docx_file_name) +1) thru - 1 of docx_file_name end repeat return docx_file_name
end run
Press [space] to view a list of the last modified .docx Files.

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "reference_pptx_path" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notification set pptx_file_name to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in pptx_file_name) > 0 set pptx_file_name to text ((offset of "/" in pptx_file_name) +1) thru - 1 of pptx_file_name end repeat return pptx_file_name
end run
Press [space] to view a list of recently modified .pptx Files.

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "pdf_engine" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
return "{query}"
end run
ATTENTION: This command only selects a PDF-Engine, is does NOT install it.

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "further_pandoc_args" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
return "{query}"
end run
Set additional options for the Pandoc Command
if your library isn't showing up, open the Pandoc Suite Documentation for a workaround

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "bibtex_library_path" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notificattion set bibtex_library_path to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in bibtex_library_path) > 0 set bibtex_library_path to text ((offset of "/" in bibtex_library_path) +1) thru - 1 of bibtex_library_path end repeat return bibtex_library_path
end run

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "slide_level" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" with exportable end tell
return "{query}"
end run

[{"title":"Slide-Level 1️⃣","arg":"1","subtitle":"H1 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 2️⃣","arg":"2","subtitle":"H2 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 3️⃣","arg":"3","subtitle":"H3 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Slide-Level 4️⃣","arg":"4","subtitle":"H4 will be used as slide titles"},{"title":"Consult Pandoc Manual on Slide Levels & Slide Structure","arg":"pandoc_website","subtitle":"https:\/\/pandoc.org\/MANUAL.html#structuring-the-slide-show"}]
Set the Slide-Level for Conversions to Powerpoint
'H{query}' will now be used for slide titles.
mailto:grieser.chris%2bpandoc@gmail.com?subject=[Pandoc-Suite] Issue Report&body=Please report your issue here. %0A%0A---%0AAlfred Version: {var:version1}%0APandoc-Suite Version: {var:version2}

on run
tell application "Alfred" set configuration "citation_picker" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
return "{query}"
end run

[{"title":"🏛 Classic Citation Picker","arg":"classic","subtitle":"Zotero GUI. (⚠️ Zotero must be installed!)"},{"title":"🆕 ✴️ Alternative Citation Picker","arg":"alternative","subtitle":"quicker, uses Alfred as GUI, Zotero does not need to be running"}]

on run
--sets Alfred Environment Variable tell application "Alfred" set configuration "second_library" to value "{query}" in workflow "de.chris-grieser.pandoc-alfred" end tell
-- removes file path for Notificattion set second_library to "{query}" repeat while (offset of "/" in bibtex_library_path) > 0 set second_library to text ((offset of "/" in second_library) +1) thru - 1 of second_library end repeat return second_library
end run
if your library isn't showing up, open the Pandoc Suite Documentation for a workaround
Search additional BibTeX Library. Press [Esc] to leave this setting empty and only use one library file.

Documentation & Usage Guide =========================== ➡️ https://chris-grieser.de/pandoc_alfred
Release Notes =============
3.7 further improvements for the alternative citation picker ------------------------------------------------------------- - The alternative citation picker is now blazing fast! Only the first run will take a moment to construct a buffer. (Took me a while to figure out how to to this correctly) - volume and issue number are now displayed next to journal titles. - cleaned up a lot of formatting like curly brackets (`{}`) still appearing somewhere - DOIs are now also indicated by the presence of an icon (not sure about what icon is approriate though) - if there is no URL but a DOI, the DOI is transformed into an URL that can be opened via `⌃ + ↵` - `cmd+c` now copies the URL instead of citekey (for easy sharing of references, e.g. via mail). Again, if there is not URL, the DOI is used instead - speed improvement when copying the bibliography via `fn + ↵`, now happens practically instantly - the citation picker now also uses the bibliography of the second library chossen via `pconf`
ℹ️📍3.6: More Improvements to the alternative Citation Picker ------------------------------------------------------------- - `cmd+c` to copy the citekey to the clipboard (without pasting, page numbers or further citations) - improved speed of the Citation Picker - prevent accidental triggering of URLs in the Picker when there is none - now also shows book titles when the entry is a book chapter - enabled autocompletion (via `tab`) - citation picker now remembers choices, i.e. when an entry is chosen multiple times, it will appear on top
ℹ️📍 3.5: Improved Alternative Ciation Picker ---------------------------------------------- Essentially, it is now an extensive Citation Picker, allowing you to copy a citation, open the URL, copy the full bibliography, or open the entry in BibDesk. Give it a try by selecting the new citation picker via the `pconf` command. If you prefer the classic citation picker, you can switch back via `pconf` anytime. [Visit the documentation for a description of all features of the Alternative citation picker.](https://www.notion.so/chrisgrieser/Pandoc-Suite-for-Citations-and-Bibliographies-in-Markdown-4de4bd634ceb4533a1add8b105a487b1#1b6226f58f1046a5af0a5d1568277135)
Changes in Detail - You can now also trigger the alternative citation picker via the Alfred keyword `cite` - Indicates the existence of an URL for an entry with an icon. Use `⌃ + ↵` to open the URL (instead of creating a citation). - `fn + ↵`: Paste the full bibliography of the entry (instead of creating a citation). Uses the same citation style you have specified via `pconf` - `⌥ ↵`: open the respective citation in [BibDesk](http://bibdesk.sourceforge.net). - Shows the journal in the citation picker for applicable entry types.
3.2 - the citations are now linked to the bibliography (= you can click them to jump the entry in the Bibliography section. )
3.1 - Support for other reference managers: The reference management app should use BibTeX as library format. [Jabref](https://www.jabref.org) and [BibDesk](http://bibdesk.sourceforge.net) are two open source reference managers that do so. To use the Pandoc Suite without Zotero, you must select the **alternative citation picker**. The Pandoc Suite now searches the home folder when locating .csl files. - Option to set a second bibliography via `pconf`. Leave empty to only use one bibliography. - displays editors of the publication in the alternative citation picker when there is no author - various smaller fixes
3.0: Alternative Citation Picker! - ➡️ Select the new citation picker via the `pconf` command. If you prefer the classic citation picker, just switch back via `pconf` - Zotero does not need to be running to pick citations (uses the BibTeX-Library directly) - uses Alfred instead of Zotero as GUI for the Picker - works much faster & is more reliable - `⌘ ↵` to add page numbers, `⌥ ↵` to add another citation. `⌘⌥ ↵` to add page numbers and then add another citation.
2.11 - send an email to report issues to the developer via `pconf` - fixed bug keeping `pconf` open even though exiting
2.10 - fix with the startup of Zotero when calling the Citaiton Picker
2.9 - speed up of the Citation Picker
2.8 - fixed yet another issue with BibTeX-Library recognition. (This is an Alfred/Spotlight issue, not an issue with the workflow, sorry!) [See here for further information](https://www.notion.so/chrisgrieser/Pandoc-Suite-for-Citations-and-Bibliographies-in-Markdown-4de4bd634ceb4533a1add8b105a487b1#fee2253fe00c4e62a6f2a818dd4397c3), when you have trouble selecting a library file via `pconf`.
2.7 - Zotero stays in the background when triggering the Citation Picker - properly starts Zotero before displaying the picker
2.6 - refactoring and other internal improvements - minor corrections in spelling
2.5 - better visualizations of notifications, messages, and the pconf-menu
2.4 - bugfix with iA Writer file recognition - support for file recognition from CotEditor - prevents running of non-Markdown files when in texteditors
2.3.2 - minor bug fix with pconf
2.3.1 - fixed yet another problem with Alfred finding .bib files. Seriously Alfred devs, I love you, but why are you making this so hard?
2.3 - when an error is encountered during the pandoc conversion (typically missing citations), an error log file is created and saved at the same location of the output
2.2.1 - fixed a bug where some latex-based pdf engines are not recognized by Alfred due to missing PATH-inclusion - fixed a bug where bibtex files are sometimes not recognized in the pconf-settings
2.2: - support for Hotkey use in Atom [they offer a plugin for Markdown](https://atom.io/packages/language-markdown). - uses "~" instead of the home directory in the pconf-settings, to make life easier for people saving their data in the cloud. - additional error messages when necessary settings have not been made
2.1 - improved info on PDF engines - improved documentation - loop for pconf to make the configuration of multiple settings easier
2.0 - due to popular request, changed the trigger of this workflow: the hotkey now also works for files selected in Finder, an option most convenient for people not familiar with Alfred. - other than that, it is now also possible to trigger Pandoc via file action.
1.3.1 - Because of the deprecation of pandoc-citeproc and its substitution with --citeproc (which was implemented in v 1.2.1 of this workflow), style folders can be set automatically. This means installation of this workflow for new users is simplified.
1.3 - enables automatic updates via OneUpdater (https://github.com/vitorgalvao/alfred-workflows/tree/master/OneUpdater) and some minor refactoring of the pconf-command
1.2.1 - fix: uses "--citeproc" as parameter due to the deprecation of pandoc-citeproc with pandoc version 2.11 (fixes this workflow for people installing pandoc after November 2020)
1.2 - conversion to Powerpoint and the addition of the respective settings
1.1 - changed default hotkeys for higher compatibility - added support for images while converting (with the --resource-path parameter)
default citation picker definiton & setting migration from 3.0 to 3.1

GREEN HOTKEY: Double-click to define
Triggers Pandoc Conversion

RED HOTKEY: Double-click to define
Citation Picker
Configuration of PanDoc Parameters (= settings of this workflow)
saves path for revealing in Finder
if Zotero is not running, launch it
